lookup.name: currency_units

lookup.name: digitlkp
lookup.comment: The default look-up for numbers.

lookup.name: digitlkp_join
lookup.comment: The same as digitlkp, but all *_joins set to 'and', so that numbers such as 'one million and seventy' will be read correctly

lookup.name: digitlkp_s
lookup.comment: Look-up for numbers ending s, e.g. under-sixteens

lookup.exp: {"i":"one","ii":"two","iii":"three","iv":"four","v":"five","vi":"six","vii":"seven","viii":"eight","ix":"nine","x":"ten","xi":"eleven","xii":"twelve","xiii":"thirteen","xiv":"fourteen","xv":"fifteen","xvi":"sixteen","xvii":"seventeen","xviii":"eighteen","xix":"nineteen","xx":"twenty","xxi":"twenty one","xxii":"twenty two","xxiii":"twenty three","xxiv":"twenty four","xxv":"twenty five", "I":"one","II":"two","III":"three","IV":"four","V":"five","VI":"six","VII":"seven","VIII":"eight","IX":"nine","X":"ten","XI":"eleven","XII":"twelve","XIII":"thirteen","XIV":"fourteen","XV":"fifteen","XVI":"sixteen","XVII":"seventeen","XVIII":"eighteen","XIX":"nineteen","XX":"twenty","XXI":"twenty one","XXII":"twenty two","XXIII":"twenty three","XXIV":"twenty four","XXV":"twenty five"}

lookup.name: signs
lookup.comment: Important, do not delete: Used by the hard-coded rule "H:aschars"
lookup.exp: {"\\":"backslash", "_": "underscore", "*":"asterisk", "^":"caret", "#":"hash", "@":"at", ".":"dot", "~":"tilde", "%":"percent", "<":"less than", ">":"more than", "≤":"less than or equal to", "≥":"greater than or equal to", "=":"equals", "&":"ampersand", "+":"plus", "÷": "divided by", "¢": "cents", ":":"colon", "/":"slash", ",":"comma", "°":"degrees", "?":"question mark", "!":"exclamation mark", "½":"half", "¼":"quarter", "¾":"three quarters", "©":"copyright", "®":" ", "™":"t m", "²":"squared", "³":"cubed", "×":"times", "·":"point", "√":"square root"}

lookup.name: standarddigits
lookup.comment: The only difference between this table and 'digitlkp' is the treatment of '0'. Spoken as 'oh' rather than zero

lookup.name: symbols
lookup.comment: Important, do not delete: Used by the hard-coded rule "H:aschars"
lookup.exp: {"\\":"backslash", "_": "underscore", "*":"asterisk", "^":"caret", "#":"hash", "@":"at", ".":"dot", "~":"tilde", "%":"percent", "<":"less than", ">":"more than", "≤":"less than or equal to", "≥":"greater than or equal to", "=":"equals", "&":"ampersand", "+":"plus", "÷": "divided by", "¢": "cents", ":":"colon", "/":"slash", ",":"comma", "°":"degrees", "?":"question mark", "!":"exclamation mark", "½":"half", "¼":"quarter", "¾":"three quarters", "©":"copyright", "®":" ", "™":"t m", "²":"squared", "³":"cubed", "×":"times", "·":"point", "√":"square root", "-":"hyphen"}

lookup.exp: {'00':'hundred', '0':'oh', '01':'oh one', '02':'oh two', '03':'oh three', '04':'oh four', '05':'oh five', '06':'oh six', '07':'oh seven', '08':'oh eight', '09':'oh nine', '1':'one', '10':'ten', '11':'eleven', '12':'twelve', '13':'thirteen', '14':'fourteen', '15':'fifteen', '16':'sixteen', '17':'seventeen', '18':'eighteen', '19':'nineteen', '2':'two', '20':'twenty', '3':'three', '30':'thirty', '4':'four', '40':'forty', '5':'five', '50':'fifty', '6':'six', '60':'sixty', '7':'seven', '70':'seventy', '8':'eight', '80':'eighty', '9':'nine', '90':'ninety', 'tens_join':'', 'billion':'billion', 'billion_join':'', 'billion_plural':'billion', 'hundred':'hundred', 'hundred_join':'and', 'hundred_plural':'hundred', 'million':'million', 'million_join':'', 'million_plural':'million', 'thousand':'thousand', 'thousand_join':'and', 'thousand_plural':'thousand', '-':'minus'}
